message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ST, cs.IT, cs.SY 

The paper deals with online decision-making problems, specifically in the context of bandit problems. It employs tools from self-normalized processes, which are commonly used in machine learning and statistics, indicating a likely fit with the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also discusses the construction of confidence sets, which is a common topic in the cs.ST (Statistics) sub-category. The use of martingales and control problems suggests a possible fit with the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. The paper also deals with optimization and estimation, which are common topics in the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-categories.
